intro: Phacelia pinnatifida var. pedunculosa, commonly known as the slender phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant has pinnately divided leaves, which are finely toothed and often covered in a soft, fuzzy coating. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for pollinators and a subject of interest in ecological studies.
